title: How Many Calories in Spunk?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in spunk (semen), including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients per typical serving, with quick facts and variations.
assumptions: Typical human male ejaculation (approx. 3.5 ml); composition based on average seminal fluid (water, fructose, proteins, minerals); no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and volume; values are approximate. Consult medical sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One typical serving of spunk contains about 15 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts style for comparison; scaled to typical serving size.

tweaks.label: Larger volume serving (5 ml vs. 3.5 ml)

faqs.q: How many calories in spunk per serving?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal in a typical 3.5 ml serving.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in spunk besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly 2.2 g carbs (sugars like fructose), 0.5 g protein, and trace fat/minerals.
Yes, about 0.5 g per serving, from enzymes and proteins.

faqs.q: How does volume affect calories in spunk?
faqs.a: Calories scale with volume; average 3-5 ml ranges 10-25 kcal.
Yes, but it has natural sugars (fructose) contributing most carbs at ~2.2 g per serving.
